label: Hello World
info: ::: aim The hello world flow in Node-RED. ::: ::: explanation All flows in Node-RED require an input and generate some output. These two nodes are the simplest of both types: inject node is the input and the debug node displays the output. Together these two nodes form a *flow*. They are also grouped together by the *group* labelled hello world. The *wire* between the two nodes shows the flow of the data: from the inject node to the debug node. The inject node has a button (not shown here but in Node-RED) which when pressed will generate input, in this case, the string `hello world`. The debug node will simply display that string in the *debug panel* within Node-RED. But: this won't happen until the flow has been *deployed*. Deploying a flow means transporting it to the server which executes flows. Node-RED is a classic client-server architecture with the browser being the client and the server being wherever Node-RED was installed. All changes to flows must first be deployed to the server to be executed there. :::
